definition: to live in a foreign place/to live somewhere as a guest
customer/visitor/guest
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
surname Ju
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms

sentences.english: Living in a strange land is not always a pleasant thing.
sentences.chinese: 客居他鄉並不總是一件令人愉快的事。

sentences.english: On hearing it, those Swiss living abroad will feel homesick.
sentences.chinese: 客居異鄉的瑞士人聽了放牧調會引起強烈的思鄉之情。

sentences.english: More than one hundred old fogies migrated to Qingdao occupied by Genmany after the Qing Dynasty's abdication.
sentences.chinese: 清廷遜位後，一百多名遺老客居德人佔據的青島。

sentences.english: To choose foreignness is an act of disloyalty to one's native country.
sentences.chinese: 選擇客居，可以說是一種對故土的不忠行爲。

sentences.english: This is my home away from home.
sentences.chinese: 這是我客居在外時暫住的家。

sentences.english: Besides, the paper also interprets the connotation of inquilinism from four sides.
sentences.chinese: 從四個層次來解讀姜夔客居意識的獨特內涵。

definition: to make one's home in/to reside in/to inhabit
to live abroad/to be traveling/traveler
native/person from a particular place
to live far away from one's native place/to reside in a foreign country
foreign land/a place far from home
to lead a quiet and peaceful life in retirement/to stay home with nothing to do/to lead a solitary life
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
variant of 漂泊[piao1 bo2]
to settle (in some city, country etc)/to take up residence
ancestral hometown/original domicile (and civil registration)
to live in seclusion
to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
native country/one's homeland
former residence/one's original home
to travel far/distant wanderings
(of officials in imperial China) to live in banishment
